assignments.title: learn subscration
assignments.description:
##LEARNING##
Subtraction is when you take a number away from another number. When you 'subtract 3,' it means you are taking three things away from a group. For example, if you have 5 apples and you subtract 3, you will have 2 apples left. It's like finding out how many are left after some go away.

##QUIZ##
1. If you have 7 cookies and subtract 3, how many do you have left?A) 3B) 4*C) 7D) 102. What does 'subtract' mean?A) To add numbers togetherB) To multiply numbersC) To take a number away from another*D) To divide numbers3. If you have 10 toys and you subtract 3, how many toys are left?A) 5B) 6C) 7*D) 84. Which of these is an example of subtracting 3?A) 2 + 3 = 5B) 6 - 3 = 3*C) 3 x 2 = 6D) 9 / 3 = 35. You have 4 balloons and 3 float away. How many balloons do you have now?A) 0B) 1*C) 3D) 76. What is 8 minus 3?A) 11B) 5*C) 4D) 3
